actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: Concerning the prohibition on the use of United States passports for travel to Lebanon.
short_title: Freedom of Travel to Lebanon Act
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Freedom of Travel to Lebanon Act - Urges the Secretary of State to do the following: (1) change the prohibition on the use of U.S. passports for travel to Lebanon to a travel advisory; (2) identify conditions there that pose risks to U.S. citizens and provide suggestions for the Government of Lebanon to ameliorate them; (3) if deciding to renew the ban on travel to Lebanon, create a new waiver category to permit exceptions for U.S. business personnel who wish to travel there on business; and (4) expand the present humanitarian waiver provisions to permit American citizens of Lebanese descent to travel to Lebanon for family reunification purposes.

titles.title: Freedom of Travel to Lebanon Act
Concerning the prohibition on the use of United States passports for travel to Lebanon.
